_assets.title: Class 3 Drug Alert (Action within 5 days): GlaxoSmithKline / Parallel Distributors - Avandia 4mg, Avandia 8mg, Avandamet 1mg/500mg*, Avandamet 2mg/500mg, Avandamet 2mg/1000mg, Avandamet - EL(10)A/22 (170Kb)

body:
## DRUG ALERT

CLASS 3 MEDICINES RECALL 

Action within 5 Days    
PHARMACY LEVEL RECALL   
  
21 October 2010  |   |  EL(10)A/22  |   |  Our ref:  MDR 47-10/10   | 

* * *

Dear Healthcare Professional,  
  
 GlaxoSmithKline / Parallel Distributors |   
 Avandia 4mg |   
 Avandia 8mg |   
 Avandamet 1mg/500mg* |   
 Avandamet 2mg/500mg |   
 Avandamet 2mg/1000mg |   
 Avandamet 4mg/1000mg |   
 (Rosiglitazone / Rosiglitazone + Metformin) |   
 *Product parallel distributed only | 

  
  


 

 

 

 

 

 

Following the European Medicines Agency (EMA) recommendation on 23 September 2010 to suspend marketing authorisations for all products containing rosiglitazone across Europe, GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) announced in its letter to healthcare providers dated 1 October 2010 that all presentations of Avandia and Avandamet would no longer be available after 21 October 2010. All undispensed UK packs purchased through their approved suppliers, Alliance Healthcare and AAH Pharmaceuticals, are being recalled.

They should be returned via the relevant wholesaler. Please contact GSK Customer Services on 0800 221 441 for stock return enquiries.

All parallel distributed presentations containing rosiglitazone are also within the scope of this recall. These should be returned to the relevant importer via the wholesaler from which they were originally obtained.

For all medical information enquiries, please contact GSK Medical Information on 0800 221 441

Recipients of this Drug Alert should bring it to the attention of relevant contacts by copy of this letter. Primary Care Trusts are asked to forward this to relevant clinics and to general practitioners and community pharmacists for information.

Yours faithfully  
Alison Bunce  
Pharmaceutical Assessor, DMRC

MHRA Distribution (further recipients by cascade):    
Regional contacts for NHS trusts and provider units   
Chief pharmacists: England, Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland   
Prison Health Policy Unit (DH)   
Chief pharmacists: Jersey, Guernsey, Alderney, Sark, Isle of Man, Gibraltar   
Special hospitals   
Healthcare commission for distribution to independent health care establishments   
Primary care trusts (England) 

### Download documents:  
  
  * [ASSET_TAG](#ASSET0)
